Freedom of Movement

Level 4 Abjuration Spell

Snap an ally out of any Stun. Difficult Terrain can't slow them down, and they can't be magically Paralysed or Restrained.

If the target is Restrained by non-magical means, it can spend 1.5m of movement to free itself.

Freedom of Movement is a Spell in Baldur's Gate 3. Freedom of Movement is a Lvl 4 Spell from the Abjuration school. Spells can be used for dealing damage to Enemies, inflict Status Ailments, buff Characters or interact with the environment.

Freedom of Movement Information

Description: Snap an ally out of any Stun. Difficult Terrain can't slow them down, and they can't be magically Paralysed or Restrained. If the target is Restrained by non-magical means, it can spend 1.5m of movement to free itself. Level: Lvl 4 spell School: Abjuration School Casting Time: Action Range: 1.5 m / 5 ft Duration: Until Long Rest Requires Concentration: No Saving Throw: None

Freedom of Movement can be acquired by the following classes: Bard, Cleric, Druid Freedom of Movement can be cast by using the following Items: ???

Bard, Cleric, Druid

Freedom of Movement Tips & Notes

For any non-summon spell that lasts until Long Rest, the caster does not need to be in your party once you leave camp as long as the spell does not require concentration. Therefore, you can easily cast this spell on any party members you plan to use while leaving the caster back in camp. If the caster of this spell removes it from their prepared spells list, the spell's effect will end immediately.
